item.title: Start a postdoc life
item.description: I start a new research life as a postdoc in the Geological Survey of Japan (AIST) in April. My job is to participate in the STAR-E (Seismology TowArd Research innovation with data of Earthquake) project organized by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology in Japan.

item.title: CV
item.description: Yasunori Sawaki Career Apr. 2023–now Post-doctoral researcher in Geological Survey of Japan (AIST) Degree Mar. 2023 | Ph.D. (Science) in Kyoto University, Japan Mar. 2020 | M.Sc. in Kyoto University, Japan Mar. 2018 | B.Sc. in Tohoku University, Japan Academic background Apr.

item.title: Doctor of Philosophy in Science
item.description: I was awarded “Doctor of Philosophy in Science” by Kyoto University on March 23, 2023. The title of my PhD dissertation is “Heterogeneous seismic structure in onshore and offshore areas of the Nankai subduction zone with receiver-side responses to regional deep-focus and teleseismic earthquakes”.

item.title: Slow-to-Fast Earthquake Workshop in Taiwan
item.description: In the middle of March 2023, Slow-to-Fast Earthquake Workshop was held in Taiwan and I had a poster presentation “Impedance contrast in the Nankai subduction zone”.

item.title: Published Homepage!
item.description:
I finally published my homepage!
The URL is here: https://yasuit21.github.io/en/

item.title: Links
item.description: Universities [EQHZ] Research Center for Earthquake Hazards, DPRI, Kyoto University Earthquake Research Institute, The University of Tokyo Research Center for Prediction of Earthquakes and Volcanic Eruptions, Graduate School of Science, Tohoku University Institute of Seismology and Volcanology, Kyushu University Research institutes Seismological projects Science of Slow-to-Fast Earthquakes | Grant-in-Aid for Transformative Research Areas (A) Science of Slow Earthquakes Catalogs Slow Earthquake Database (Kano et al.

item.title: Slow-to-Fast Earthquake A03 group workshop in Beppu
item.description: A03 group for Slow-to-Fast Earthquake held a workshop in Beppu city in Feb 9–11 2023. I had a talk about the spatial relationship of slow earthquakes and seismic impedance contrasts in the Nankai subduction zone.

item.title: CV and publication list
item.description: Publication list was created. CV was created. Links was created.

item.title: Privacy policy
item.description: Use of Cookie and Google Analytics This website uses Google’s access analysis tool “Google Analytics” to analyze access conditions. Google Analytics uses cookies to collect data. This data is collected anonymously and is not personally identifiable. You can disable this feature by disabling cookies.

item.title: Defense of my Doctral Dissertation
item.description: The defense of my PhD thesis was held on Jan. 16, 2023. It was the greatest moment ever in my research life.

item.title: Hello World!
item.description: This is the first post. I’m testing the English page.

item.title: Publication list
item.description: Peer-reviewed scientific articles Akuhara, Takeshi, Yusuke Yamashita, Shukei Ohyanagi, Yasunori Sawaki, Tomoaki Yamada, and Masanao Shinohara, (2023). Shallow low-velocity layer in the Hyuga-nada accretionary prism and its hydrological implications: Insights from a passive seismic array. Journal of Geophysical Research: Solid Earth, 128, e2022JB026298.
